course.subject: CHEM
course.name: Intermediate Organic Chemistry
course.description: Provides further training in the multistep organic synthesis of natural and unnatural products, and will focus on the retrosynthetic analysis, control of stereochemistry, carbonyl group chemistry, and pericyclic reactions with a brief coverage on new synthetic methodologies for efficient synthesis of compound libraries. A prerequisite for students wishing to take CHEM 5110/5120 as part of their undergraduate program.

reviews.author: tommylau
reviews.title: Must take course for all chemistry major student, take it or you will regret
reviews.comment_content:
Content

1-Introduction
2-Stereochemistry part I: Stereochemical Principles
3-Stereochemistry part II: Stereochemistry of Reactions
4- Retrosynthetic Analysis & Synthetic Strategy
5-Functional Group Interconversion
Mid-term Examination
6-Carbonyl Group Chemistry I
7-Carbonyl Group Chemistry II
8-Pericyclic Reactions
9-Diversity-Oriented Synthesis & Multicomponent Reactions
Final Examination
reviews.comment_teaching:
Very enthusiastic teaching, clear English and explain the concept so clear even someone who got only a B+ in organic chemistry II can understand (which is me)
He is also very kind, like the mean in the midterm is quite low like 49/103 and he said he would make the final easier and indeed the mean of the final is higher and the problem is obviously easier
reviews.comment_workload: Zero workload, just attend the lecture and do some review before the exam can secure an A.

reviews.comment_teaching: I don't like organic chemistry but prof HUANG is a good teacher. His lectures were clear and organized, and he was friendly.
reviews.comment_workload: It depends. I think the workload is very very light if you only want a b-ranged grade. However, I do think it requires hard work if you wish to fully comprehend the contents.

reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Huang really want to let us to understand all mechanism in the syllabus,so he tried to teach many things within the syllabus.Also if you have any question and ask him,he will reply as soon as possible
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments/essay (20%)
Mid-term Examination (35%)
Final Examination (45%)

For me,mid term about mean....
For the assignment,I forgot to use the template.....
so assignment near lowest.........
final also near lowest
But still I get B.I do think it is a good grade course
reviews.comment_workload: I think the workload is fair.But still have workload especially for the essay,you need to find the topic yourself.For the mid term.It contains MC and short questions.For the final,there have MCQ,short questions and drawings.So you need to memorize something before the exam although it is the open book exam.Otherwise the time may not be enough.

reviews.author: KS1Day
reviews.comment_content:
You can see another review for details...

SYLLABUS
1-Introduction
2-StereochemistrypartI
3-StereochemistrypartII
4-RetrosyntheticAnalysis&SyntheticStrategy
5-FunctionalGroupInterconversion
6-CarbonylGroupChemistryI
7-CarbonylGroupChemistryII
8-PericyclicReactions
9-ExamplesofTotalSynthesis
10-Diversity-OrientedSynthesis&MulticomponentReactions
11-Microwave-AssistedOrganicSynthesis,Solid-PhaseOrganicSynthesis&CombinatorialSynthesis
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Huang is a great professor, he is passionate to teach and answer questions. And he often goes deeper than lecture notes, so you need to note that and sometime correct the lecture notes.

But because he gives lecture notes AFTER he taught, so watching video is important...
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment/Essay:20%
Mid-term:35%
Final:45%
Super great...
assignment, mid term mean,
final near lowest...
B
reviews.comment_workload:
Not recommend for people who have little interest in organic chemistry. And if your org chem 1,2 are not good, you need work harder, although some of the contents are overlaped, they are just fundamental in this course.

I think if you want high marks, you really have to work hard...Although it is open book(He even allows you to search internet, as long as not cheating site), it is no help for exams...
Because he really wants people to understand, not memorize, so the mid term and final are hard, you really need to know the concept of Stereochemistry and Mechanism

reviews.author: holymama
reviews.comment_content:
Introduction [Brief revision on atomic theory, periodic table, impact of molecules such as steroids and taxol on life, and importance of chemical synthesis including total synthesis of natural products]

Stereochemistry Part I. Stereochemical Principles [Molecular chirality, stereoisomers, Fischer convention, CIP convention, chiral center and axis, chirality and symmetry, optical activity, physical properties of enantiomers, prochiral relationship, stereochemical drawing techniques, stereochemical analysis, conformations of acyclic alkanes, alkenes, aldehydes and ketones, conformations of cyclohexanes, cyclohexenes and cyclohexanones, A values, 1,3-allylic strain, stereoelectronic effect, and anomeric effect]  

Stereochemistry Part II. Stereochemistry of Reactions [Chemoselectivity, regioselectivity, and stereoselectivity, heterogeneous and homogeneous catalytic hydrogenation and polar group directing effects, hydride reduction of acyclic ketones and cyclohexanones, nucleophilic addition to acyclic carbonyl groups, Cram’s rule and Felkin–Ahn model, role of electronegative substituents in Felkin–Ahn model, 1,3-asymmetric induction on reduction of β-hydroxyketones, chelation control in reduction of α-hydroxyketones, β-ketoesters, and Grignard addition to α-alkoxyketones, the Houk conformation for reactions of alkenes with electrophiles, catalytic enantioselective hydrogenation of alkenes and carbonyl groups, Sharpless asymmetric epoxidation (AE), and Sharpless asymmetric dihydroxylation (AD)]

Retrosynthetic Analysis & Synthetic Strategy [Bond disconnection approach, valid retrosynthetic steps, advantage of convergent synthesis, normal and umpolung synthons, synthetic equivalents, functional group interconversion (FGI) and functional group addition (FGA), selected strategies for reaction control]

Functional Group Interconversion [Mitsunobu reaction, selected mild methods for conversion of alcohols into alkyl halides and sulfonates and reactions with cyanides, nitrogen, oxygen, sulfur, and phosphorus nucleophiles, selected methods for formation of esters from alcohols using acyl chlorides, acyl imidazolides, mixed anhydrides O-acyl isourea, and thiol esters, selected methods for formation of amides from amines and carboxylic acids, cleavage of ethers and esters using TMSI, selected hydride reagents for reduction of esters and Weinreb’s amides to aldehydes, selective reduction of aldehydes and ketones in the presence of esters, reductive amination of aldehydes and ketones, CBS reduction of ketones to chiral alcohols, Swern oxidation, and Dess−Martin periodinane oxidation]

Carbonyl Group Chemistry I [preparation of Grignard reagents, preparation of organolithium via lithium–halide exchange, lithium–hydrogen exchange (α-lithiation, lateral lithiation, and DoM), and lithium–metal exchange, solution structures of organolithium and Grignard reagents, addition of organolithium and Grignard reagents with aldehydes, ketones, carboxylic acid derivatives, and CO2, Wittig olefination of unstabilized, semi-stabilized, and stabilized ylides, Horner–Wadsworth–Emmons (HWE) reaction, the Schlosser modification of Wittig reaction, the Horner–Wittig reaction, the Peterson reaction, the Julia reaction and variations, reactions of sulfur ylides]

Carbonyl Group Chemistry II [Chemo- and regio-selectivity in enol and enolate formation, regio-, stereo-selective aldol reactions, the Zimmermann−Traxler (chair-like) transition state, open transition state, anti-selective aldols of lithium enolates of hindered aryl esters, syn-selective aldols of boron enolates of phenylthio esters and ketones,
syn-selective aldols of zirconium enolates of amides, thioesters, and cyclic ketones, aldols of silyl enol ethers via open transition state, chiral enolates of Evans oxazolidinones, syn-selective aldol reaction of boron enolates of chiral N-acyl oxazolidinones, anti-selective aldol reaction of boron enolates of chiral N-acyl oxazolidinones under Lewis acid catalysis, proline-catalyzed enantioselective aldol reaction, the Robinson annulation, Michael addition of organo-copper(I) compounds]


Pericyclic Reactions [The Diels−Alder cycloaddition, stereospecificity, endo-selectivity, “ortho” and “para” regioselectivity, intramolecular version, effect of aqueous media, organocatalysis, Lewis acid catalysis, chiral auxiliary-derived substrates]

Examples of Total Synthesis [Total synthesis of amphidinolide T1−T5, Fürstner’s total synthesis strategy via ring-closing metathesis and hydrogenation, Dai’s total synthesis via ring-closing metathesis and asymmetric dihydroxylation]

Diversity-Oriented Synthesis & Multicomponent Reactions [Diversity-oriented synthesis (DOS) vs. target-oriented synthesis (TOS), examples of complexity-generating reactions, examples of diversity-generating processes in terms of appendage diversity, stereochemical diversity, and skeletal diversity, types of multicomponent reactions (MCRs), examples of historically significant MCRs, mechanisms of Passerini three-component reaction (P-3CR) and Ugi four-component reaction (U-4CR), examples of U-4CR using 2-aminophenols and post Ugi annulation]

Microwave-Assisted Organic Synthesis, Solid-Phase Organic Synthesis & Combinatorial Synthesis [Two mechanisms of microwave dielectric heating, difference of microwave vs. conventional thermal heating, major advantages of microwave heating, difference of solid-phase vs. solution organic synthesis, major advantages of solid-phase organic synthesis, types and roles of linkers used in solid-phase organic synthesis, difference in parallel synthesis and mix-split synthesis]
reviews.comment_teaching:
啊Dai太老啦，入面嘅學緊嘅野仲係好多年前嘅chemistry......做緊Research嘅你一定會腦洞大開....
例子: Preparation of IBX 喺2002年已經pub左用oxone, 但係佢仲教緊用KBrO3 lollll

好細聲好細聲，上堂唔專心其實就會訓著
因為lecture notes入面嘅野太齊，所以基本上唔洗上堂，不過小心入面有機會有error.......
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm (80%)
Assignment (20%)

Midterm唔難，mean 72.6/100, highest 89, lowest 33
assignment睇住lecture notes同readings其實就會識做

grading聽聞少少爛，見仁見智啦
reviews.comment_workload:
其實都係見仁見智，因為前半嘅野好多org chem 1已經學過(stereochemistry), 要溫多少少reaction就真。放心，勁少野背，因為佢會俾個reaction list你。
但係傳聞final好多reaction要背，唔知之後會點啦:P
